info.title: Codacy API
info.description:
Codacy API v3 reference.

[Import the OpenAPI 2.0 definition](https://api.codacy.com/api/api-docs/swagger.yaml) into your development tools to help bootstrap your integration with Codacy.
For more information see [Using the Codacy API](https://docs.codacy.com/codacy-api/using-the-codacy-api/).

ApiKeyAuth.name: api-token
ApiKeyAuth.description: Learn how to [generate an account API token](https://docs.codacy.com/codacy-api/api-tokens/#account-api-tokens)

SeverityLevel.description: Issue severity level. (These values map to our UI as follows: Info->Minor, Warning->Medium, Error->Critical)

PaginationInfo.description: Cursor-based pagination information to obtain more items

cursor.description: Cursor for the next items in the list

owner.description: Name of the organization that owns the repository

fullPath.description: Full path of the repository on the Git provider

remoteIdentifier.description: Unique identifier of the repository on the Git provider

lastUpdated.description: Timestamp when the repository was last updated, [depending on the Git provider](https://docs.codacy.com/organizations/organization-overview/#last-updated-repositories)

languages.description: List of the languages in the repository

commitTimestamp.description: Timestamp when the commit was created

authorEmail.description: Email address of the commit author

startedAnalysis.description: Timestamp when Codacy started the last analysis of the commit

endedAnalysis.description: Timestamp when Codacy finished the last analysis of the commit

branches.description: List of branches containing the commit

message.example: We can't analyze this repository because none of the committers are part of the organization.

code.description: A stable identifier for a problem.

severity.description: The extent to which this problem affects the repository in terms of analysis execution.

grade.description: Quality grade of the file as a number between 100 (highest grade) and 0 (lowest grade)

gradeLetter.description: Quality grade of the file as a letter between A (highest grade) and F (lowest grade)

newIssues.description: Number of issues introduced by the pull request

fixedIssues.description: Number of issues fixed by the pull request

deltaComplexity.description: Difference in cyclomatic complexity introduced by the pull request

deltaClonesCount.description: Difference in number of duplicated blocks of code introduced by the pull request

deltaCoverage.description: Difference in code coverage percentage when compared to the destination branch

diffCoverage.description: Total code coverage value for the changes in this pull request

PatternDetails.description: Details of the pattern that was identified in the issue

subCategory.description: Pattern subcategory (optional since some patterns might not have a subcategory)

level.description: Deprecated, use severity instead. Issue severity level. (These values map to our UI as follows: Info->Minor, Warning->Medium, Error->Critical)

ToolReference.description: Details of the tool that found the issue

CommitReference.description: Details of the commit that introduced the issue or null if the issue was introduced in a commit that Codacy didn't analyze

commiter.description: Email address of the author of the commit

commiterName.description: Name of the author of the commit

timestamp.description: Time and date of the commit

CommitIssue.description: Issue details including the commit that originated the issue

filePath.description: Path of the file where the issue was found

lineNumber.description: Line where the issue was found

language.description: Language of the file where the issue was found

lineText.description: Contents of the line where the issue was found

DeltaType.description: Specifies if the issue was added or fixed by the commit

CommitDeltaIssue.description: Details of an issue that was added or fixed by a commit

CommitDeltaIssuesResponse.description: List of issues added or fixed on a commit

analyzed.description: True if the commit was already analyzed by Codacy

IgnoredIssue.description: Ignored issue details including the commit that originated the issue

filePath.description: Path of the file where the issue was found and ignored

lineNumber.description: Line where the issue was found

message.description: Detailed cause of the ignored issue

language.description: Language of the file where the ignored issue was found

lineText.description: Contents of the line where the ignored issue was found

CommitDeltaStatistics.description: Delta quality metrics for a commit

newIssues.description: Number of issues introduced by the commit

fixedIssues.description: Number of issues fixed by the commit

deltaComplexity.description: Difference in cyclomatic complexity when compared to the previous commit

deltaCoverage.description: Difference in code coverage percentage when compared to the previous commit

deltaCoverageWithDecimals.description: Difference in code coverage with decimals percentage when compared to the previous commit

deltaClonesCount.description: Difference in number of duplicated blocks of code when compared to the previous commit

analyzed.description: True if the commit was already analyzed by Codacy

IssuesOverview.description: Overview of the issues in a repository

IssuesOverviewCounts.description: Overview of the issues in a repository

levels.description: Number of issues per severity level

patterns.description: Number of issues per code pattern

authors.description: Number of issues per commit author

isEnabled.description: True if Codacy should analyze the branch

issueThreshold.description: The quality gate will fail if there are new issues of the specified severity over this threshold (if no severity is specified all severity levels are considered). This value cannot be negative

securityIssueThreshold.description: The quality gate will fail if the number of new security issues is over this threshold. This value cannot be negative

duplicationThreshold.description: The quality gate will fail if there are new duplicated blocks over this threshold

coverageThreshold.description: [deprecated: use coverageThresholdWithDecimals instead] The quality gate will fail if coverage percentage varies less than this threshold. This value should be at most 1

coverageThresholdWithDecimals.description: The quality gate will fail if coverage percentage varies less than this threshold. This value should be at most 1.00

diffCoverageThreshold.description: The quality gate will fail if diff coverage is under this threshold. This value should be at least 0 and at most 100

complexityThreshold.description: The quality gate will fail if the complexity value is over this threshold. This value cannot be negative

buildServerAnalysisSetting.description:
If true, Codacy waits for your build server to upload the results of the local analysis before resuming the analysis of your commits.
If false, Codacy analyzes your commits directly on its cloud infrastructure.

If true, Codacy waits for your build server to upload the results of the local analysis before resuming the analysis of your commits.
If false, Codacy analyzes your commits directly on its cloud infrastructure.

issueThreshold.description: The repository will be considered unhealthy if the percentage of issues is over this threshold

duplicationThreshold.description: The repository will be considered unhealthy if the percentage of duplication of files is over this threshold

coverageThreshold.description: The repository will be considered unhealthy if the coverage percentage is under this threshold

complexityThreshold.description: The repository will be considered unhealthy if the percentage of complexity of files is over this threshold

fileDuplicationThreshold.description: A file in this repository will be considered duplicated when the number of cloned blocks is over this threshold

fileComplexityThreshold.description: A file in this repository will be considered complex when its complexity value is over this threshold

maxIssuePercentage.description: The repository will be considered unhealthy if the percentage of issues is over this threshold

maxDuplicatedFilesPercentage.description: The repository will be considered unhealthy if the percentage of duplication of files is over this threshold

minCoveragePercentage.description: The repository will be considered unhealthy if the coverage percentage is under this threshold

maxComplexFilesPercentage.description: The repository will be considered unhealthy if the percentage of complexity of files is over this threshold

fileDuplicationBlockThreshold.description: A file in this repository will be considered duplicated when the number of cloned blocks is over this threshold. This value cannot be negative

fileComplexityValueThreshold.description: A file in this repository will be considered complex when its complexity value is over this threshold. This value cannot be negative

ApiToken.description: API token string value and ID

email.description: Email address of the deleted account

repositoryFullPath.description: Full path of the repository on the Git provider, starting at the organization. Separate each segment of the path with a slash (/).

SearchRepositoryIssuesBody.description: Search parameters to filter the list of issues in a repository

branchName.description:
Name of a [repository branch enabled on Codacy](https://docs.codacy.com/repositories-configure/managing-branches/),
as returned by the endpoint [listRepositoryBranches](#listrepositorybranches).
By default, uses the main branch defined on the Codacy repository settings.

patternIds.description: Set of code pattern identifiers, as returned by the endpoint [listPatterns](#listpatterns)

languages.description: Set of language names, without spaces

authorEmails.description: Set of commit author email addresses

CoverageReport.description: Status and details of a coverage report

targetCommitSha.description: Commit SHA that was referenced as the target for this report

language.description: Programming language associated with the coverage report

hasCoverageOverview.description: True if the Quality evolution chart of the repository includes coverage information

Tool.description: Codacy tool that can flag patterns/issues on projects

version.description: Original tool version used by the Codacy tool wrapper

shortName.description: Tool unique short name, must contain alphanumeric characters only and no spaces

sourceCodeUrl.description: Codacy tool wrapper source code URL

prefix.description: Tool prefix used to ensure pattern names are unique

description.example: ESLint is a tool for identifying and reporting on patterns found in ECMAScript/JavaScript code. In many ways, it is similar to JSLint and JSHint with a few exceptions

dockerImage.description: Docker image used to launch tool

languages.description: List of languages that the tool supports

clientSide.description: True if the tool is supposed to run on the client's machine and the results sent to Codacy

standalone.description: True if the client-side tool runs stand-alone outside of the CLI

enabledByDefault.description: True if the tool is enabled by default for new projects (not required)

configurable.description: True if the tool is configurable on Codacy's UI

DuplicationTool.description: Codacy tool that can detect duplication on projects

dockerImage.description: Docker image used to launch tool

languages.description: List of languages that the tool supports

MetricsTool.description: Codacy tool that calculates metrics on projects

dockerImage.description: Docker image used to launch tool

languages.description: List of languages that the tool supports

Pattern.description: Code pattern that a Codacy tool can use to find issues

description.description: Short description of the code pattern
description.example: Enforce getter and setter pairs in objects and classes

explanation.description: Full description of the code pattern, in CommonMark

enabled.description: True if the code pattern is on by default for new repositories

languages.description: List of languages that the code pattern supports

timeToFix.description: Average time to fix an issue detected by the code pattern, in minutes

Parameter.description: Parameter to configure a code pattern

Person.description: Representation of a person that belongs to an organization

code.description: A stable identifier for a problem.

LeaveOrgCheckResult.description: Informs if the user can leave the organization and if not, why.

canLeave.description: True if user can leave the organization

message.example: Since you are the last owner on $orgName, to leave this organization you need to delete it. Please, contact us through support.

fileId.description: Identifier for file in any branch

branchId.description: Identifier for the branch the file belongs to

path.description: Relative path of the file in the repository

totalIssues.description: Number of issues in the file

grade.description: Quality grade of the file as a number between 100 (highest grade) and 0 (lowest grade)

gradeLetter.description: Quality grade of the file as a letter between A (highest grade) and F (lowest grade)

coverage.description: [deprecated: use coverageWithDecimals instead] Test coverage percentage of the file

coverageWithDecimals.description: Test coverage percentage of the file with decimals

duplication.description: Number of duplicated lines in the file

linesOfCode.description: Lines of code in the file

sourceLinesOfCode.description: Coverable lines of code in the file

numberOfMethods.description: Number of methods in the file

numberOfClones.description: Number of cloned blocks of code in the file

CreateCodingStandardBody.description: Details of a new coding standard

name.description: Name of the new coding standard

languages.description: List of programming languages supported by the new coding standard

SetDefaultCodingStandardBody.description: Toggle the default coding standard for an organization

isDefault.description: True if the coding standard is the default for the organization

ApplyCodingStandardToRepositoriesBody.description: Names of the repositories to link or unlink from a coding standard

link.description: Names of the repositories to link to a coding standard

unlink.description: Names of the repositories to unlink from a coding standard

UpdateCodingStandardPatternsBody.description: Specifies the update to apply to the code patterns of a tool in a coding standard

enabled.description: True enables the code patterns, and False disables them.

CodingStandardMeta.description: Meta information about a coding standard

enabledToolsCount.description: Number of tools that are enabled in the coding standard

enabledPatternsCount.description: Number of code patterns that are enabled in the coding standard

linkedRepositoriesCount.description: Number of repositories using the coding standard

isDraft.description: True if the coding standard is a draft

isDefault.description: True if the coding standard is the default for the organization

languages.description: List of programming languages supported by the coding standard

CodingStandardTool.description: Information about a tool in a coding standard

isEnabled.description: True if the tool is enabled in the coding standard

CodingStandardsListResponse.description: List of coding standards for an organization

ApplyCodingStandardToRepositoriesResult.description: Result of applying a coding standard to a list of repositories

successful.description: Names of the repositories that were successfully linked or unlinked from a coding standard

failed.description: Names of the repositories that failed to be linked or unlinked from a coding standard

CodingStandardPattern.description: Code pattern configuration for a tool in a coding standard

enabled.description: True if the code pattern is enabled in the coding standard

StandardPatternListMeta.description: Metadata for a retrieved coding standard's pattern list

RepositoryIdentification.description: Identifier and name of a repository using a coding standard

data.description: List of repositories using a coding standard

CodingStandardParameter.description: Parameter to configure a code pattern for a tool in a coding standard

ToolConfiguration.description: Configuration of a tool and its code patterns

enabled.description: True if the tool is enabled in the repository or coding standard
True if the code pattern is enabled in the repository or coding standard

parameters.description: List of code pattern parameter configurations

SearchOrganizationRepositoriesWithAnalys.description: Search organization repositories with analysis query body

languagesExtensions.description: List of languages with supported extensions

FileExtensions.description: List of supported file extensions for a specific language

codacyDefaults.description: Default Codacy extensions for the language

extensions.description: List of custom extensions for the language
List of custom file extensions for the language

languagesExtensions.description: List of custom file extensions to associate with each language for a repository

cursorParam.name: cursor
cursorParam.description: Cursor to return next items in the list

limitParam.name: limit
limitParam.description: Maximum number of items to return

daysParam.name: days
daysParam.description: Number of days with data to return.

searchParam.name: search
searchParam.description: Filter the results searching by this string.

repositoriesParam.name: repositories
repositoriesParam.description: [Deprecated: Use [SearchOrganizationRepositoriesWithAnalysis](#searchorganizationrepositorieswithanalysis) instead] Comma separated list of repositories to get

branchStatusParam.name: enabled
branchStatusParam.description: Returns only the enabled or disabled branches.

remoteOrganizationNameParam.name: remoteOrganizationName
remoteOrganizationNameParam.description: Organization name on the Git provider

repositoryNameParam.name: repositoryName
repositoryNameParam.description: Repository name on the Git provider organization

branchNameParam.name: branch
branchNameParam.description:
Name of a [repository branch enabled on Codacy](https://docs.codacy.com/repositories-configure/managing-branches/),
as returned by the endpoint [listRepositoryBranches](#listrepositorybranches).
By default, uses the main branch defined on the Codacy repository settings.

filesSearchFilter.name: search
filesSearchFilter.description: Filter files that include this string anywhere in their relative path

searchIssuesFilter.name: filters
searchIssuesFilter.description: Only return issues matching these filters

commitUuid.name: commitUuid
commitUuid.description: UUID or SHA string that identifies the commit

severityLevelsParam.name: severityLevels
severityLevelsParam.description: Filter by a comma separated list of code pattern severity levels. The allowed values are 'Error', 'Warning', and 'Info'

categoriesParam.name: categories
categoriesParam.description: Filter by a comma separated list of code pattern categories. The allowed values are 'Security', 'ErrorProne', 'CodeStyle', 'Compatibility', 'UnusedCode', and 'Performance'

patternsSortParam.name: sort
patternsSortParam.description: Field used to sort the tool's code patterns.  The allowed values are 'category', 'recommended', and 'severity'

directionParam.name: direction
directionParam.description: Sort direction. Possible values are 'asc' (ascending) or 'desc' (descending).

sourceRepositoryParam.name: sourceRepository
sourceRepositoryParam.description: Name of a repository in the same organization to use as a template when creating the new coding standard

sourceCodingStandardParam.name: sourceCodingStandard
sourceCodingStandardParam.description: Identifier of an existing coding standard to use as a template when creating the new coding standard, including the enabled repositories

toolConfigurationParam.name: toolConfiguration
toolConfigurationParam.description: Configuration of a tool and its code patterns

filesSortParam.name: sort
filesSortParam.description: Field used to sort the list of files. The allowed values are 'filename', 'issues', 'grade', 'duplication', 'complexity', and 'coverage'.

branchesSortParam.name: sort
branchesSortParam.description: Field used to sort the list of branches. The allowed values are 'name' and 'last-updated'.

get.summary: Return the version of the Codacy installation
List an organization repositories with analysis information for the authenticated user.
get.description: List an organization repositories with analysis information for the authenticated user. For Bitbucket you must URL encode the cursor before using it in subsequent API calls, as the pagination comes directly from the Git provider.

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: Git provider

parameters.name: remoteOrganizationName
parameters.description: Organization name on the Git provider

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor to return next items in the list

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items to return

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Filter the results searching by this string.

parameters.name: repositories
parameters.description: [Deprecated: Use [SearchOrganizationRepositoriesWithAnalysis](#searchorganizationrepositorieswithanalysis) instead] Comma separated list of repositories to get

post.summary: Bulk copy the patterns from a given repository
post.description:
Copy patterns from the selected repository to the targeted ones requested in the body of the operation.
This endpoints is limited to 100 target repositories.

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: Git provider

parameters.name: remoteOrganizationName
parameters.description: Organization name on the Git provider

parameters.name: repositoryName
parameters.description: Repository name on the Git provider organization

parameters.name: copyPatternsBulkBody
parameters.description: Repository names to have their patterns imported to, maximum 100 items.

get.summary: List pull requests from a repository that the user as access to
get.description: You can search this endpoint for either `last-updated` (default), `impact` or `merged`

parameters.name: provider

parameters.description: Organization name on the Git provider

parameters.name: repositoryName
parameters.description: Repository name on the Git provider organization

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor to return next items in the list

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Filter the results searching by this string.

parameters.name: includeNotAnalyzed
parameters.description: If true, also return pull requests that weren't analyzed

post.summary: Regenerate the user SSH key that Codacy uses to clone the repository
post.description: Codacy automatically adds the new public user SSH key to the user account on the Git provider. Using a user SSH key is recommended if your repository includes submodules.

get.summary: Lists commit analysis statistics in the last `n` days that have analysis data
get.description: Returns the last `n` days with available data. This means that the returned days may not match the last `n` calendar days

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: Git provider

parameters.name: remoteOrganizationName
parameters.description: Organization name on the Git provider

parameters.name: repositoryName
parameters.description: Repository name on the Git provider organization

parameters.name: branch
parameters.description:
Name of a [repository branch enabled on Codacy](https://docs.codacy.com/repositories-configure/managing-branches/),
as returned by the endpoint [listRepositoryBranches](#listrepositorybranches).
By default, uses the main branch defined on the Codacy repository settings.

parameters.name: days
parameters.description: Number of days with data to return.

post.summary: List issues in a repository
post.description:
Returns information about the issues that Codacy found in a repository as available on the [Issues page](https://docs.codacy.com/repositories/issues-view/).
Use [SearchRepositoryIssuesBody](#tocssearchrepositoryissuesbody) to filter the returned issues.

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: Git provider

parameters.name: remoteOrganizationName
parameters.description: Organization name on the Git provider

parameters.name: repositoryName
parameters.description: Repository name on the Git provider organization

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: Only return issues matching these filters

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor to return next items in the list

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items to return

200.description: List of issues in the repository

post.summary: Get an overview of the issues in a repository
post.description:
Returns information about the number of issues that Codacy found in a repository as available on the [Issues page](https://docs.codacy.com/repositories/issues-view/).
Use [SearchRepositoryIssuesBody](#tocssearchrepositoryissuesbody) to filter the returned issues.

parameters.name: provider

get.summary: Get analysis statistics of a commit
get.description:
Returns the quality metric deltas introduced by a commit. The values of the metrics are 0 or null if Codacy didn't analyze the commit yet.
To obtain the full analysis statistics for the repository use the endpoint [getRepositoryWithAnalysis](#getrepositorywithanalysis).

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: Git provider

parameters.name: remoteOrganizationName
parameters.description: Organization name on the Git provider

parameters.name: repositoryName
parameters.description: Repository name on the Git provider organization

parameters.name: commitUuid
parameters.description: UUID or SHA string that identifies the commit

get.summary: List the issues introduced or fixed by a commit
get.description:
Returns the list of issues that were introduced or fixed by a commit. A value of false in the analyzed field means that Codacy didnt analyze the commit yet, hence the list of issues will always be empty in this case.
To obtain the full list of issues in the repository use the endpoint [searchRepositoryIssues](#searchrepositoryissues).

get.summary: List an organization repositories for the authenticated user.
get.description:
List an organization's repositories for the authenticated user.
For Bitbucket you must URL encode the cursor before using it in subsequent API calls, as the pagination comes directly from the Git provider.
This endpoint may return more results than those specified in the limit parameter.
If this endpoint doesn't return your repositories after you've made recent changes to the permissions on your Git provider,
use the endpoint [cleanCache](#cleanCache) to force refreshing the list of repositories for the authenticated user.

post.summary: Create pull request adding codacy badge in the Public GitHub repository
post.description:
Creates pull request adding the codacy badge to the README of the Public GitHub repository.

**Notes:**
- Only works for public GitHub repositories
- The pull request is created asynchronously, and for that reason,
  it might fail even if this endpoint responds successfully.
- Does not create the pull request if the badge already exists.

get.summary: List files in a repository
get.description:
Returns the most recent analysis information for the files in a repository as available on the [Files page](https://docs.codacy.com/repositories/files-view/).
Files that are [ignored on Codacy](https://docs.codacy.com/repositories-configure/ignoring-files/) aren't returned.

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: Git provider

parameters.name: remoteOrganizationName
parameters.description: Organization name on the Git provider

parameters.name: repositoryName
parameters.description: Repository name on the Git provider organization

parameters.name: branch
parameters.description:
Name of a [repository branch enabled on Codacy](https://docs.codacy.com/repositories-configure/managing-branches/),
as returned by the endpoint [listRepositoryBranches](#listrepositorybranches).
By default, uses the main branch defined on the Codacy repository settings.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Filter files that include this string anywhere in their relative path

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Field used to sort the list of files. The allowed values are 'filename', 'issues', 'grade', 'duplication', 'complexity', and 'coverage'.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Sort direction. Possible values are 'asc' (ascending) or 'desc' (descending).

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor to return next items in the list

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items to return

200.description: List of files in the repository

patch.summary: Configure a tool in a draft coding standard.
patch.description:
Toggle a tool and configure its code patterns in a draft coding standard.
Only the code patterns included in the body are updated, and if there are none only the enabled status of the tool is set.
You can only update draft coding standards and configure a maximum of 1000 code patterns per call.

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: Git provider

parameters.name: remoteOrganizationName
parameters.description: Organization name on the Git provider

parameters.name: codingStandardId
parameters.description: Coding standard identifier

parameters.name: toolUuid
parameters.description: Tool unique identifier

parameters.name: toolConfiguration
parameters.description: Configuration of a tool and its code patterns
